intro: [WRONG START] Carex taipaishaanica, commonly known as the Taipaishan sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and local biodiversity.
